meanings.definition: To grow old or show signs of aging.
meanings.sent1: The leaves senesced and turned yellow in the autumn.
meanings.sent2: The old dog senesced gracefully, with a white muzzle and slow gait.
meanings.sent3: The antique clock senesced like a wise old grandfather, ticking slower with each passing year.
meanings.sent4: As the building senesced, its walls seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: Her wrinkled hands senesced, telling the tale of a life well-lived.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned house senesced, its paint peeling and windows cracked.
meanings.sent2: The once vibrant painting senesced over time, losing its colors to fading.
meanings.sent3: The neglected garden senesced into a wild tangle of weeds and overgrown bushes.
meanings.sent4: The memories of youth senesced like old photographs, fading and blurring with each passing year.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins senesced under the weight of centuries, crumbling into dust.
